summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding access to scanned documents from the Jeffrey Epstein investigation in Florida. The email discusses obtaining defense letters, draft indictments, and other materials stored on a shared drive.

persons.name: Lou
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who will be contacted to provide share drive access for the recipients to view Epstein case files.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; the email discusses accessing scanned documents related to his case, including defense letters and draft indictments.

connections.description: Lou is being contacted to provide access to Epstein's case files on a shared drive.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein case files
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discuss obtaining scanned documents from the Florida investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, including defense submissions and draft indictments.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email confirms the existence of scanned documents from the Florida investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, including defense letters and draft indictments.
The files were stored on a shared drive at Usa.doj.gov, specifically in folders for 'Letters from Epstein's attorneys' and 'GJ' (likely Grand Jury) materials.
The correspondence indicates ongoing interest and review of the Epstein case by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in January 2019.
The email references case number 'USvEpstein-2018R01618', indicating it was part of the 2018 legal proceedings.
The sender mentions that most files are too large to send via email, necessitating share drive access.
